sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The arctan function is used to find the arc tangent of a value. The result is given in radians. For example, arctan (1) is p / 4.
sections.text_content: The arctan function is used to find the arc tangent of a value. The result is given in radians. For example, arctan (1) is p / 4.
sections.mdown_content: The **arctan** function is used to find the arc tangent of a value. The result is given in radians. For example, **arctan** (1) is p / 4.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 0 .. 12
            const arg := i / 4
            put "Arc tangent of ", arg, " is ",
                arctan (arg), " radians"
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the arctangent of 0 through 3 in radians.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the arctangent of 0 through 3 in radians.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the arctangent of 0 through 3 in radians.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the arcsin and arccos functions for calculating arcsine and arccosine

the arctand function which finds the arc tangent of a value with the result given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.text_content:
the arcsin and arccos functions for calculating arcsine and arccosine
the arctand function which finds the arc tangent of a value with the result given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[arcsin.html](arcsin)** and **[arccos.html](arccos)** functions for calculating arcsine and arccosine
the **[arctand.html](arctand)** function which finds the arc tangent of a value with the result given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
